snippet.title: Lavish luxury binge EXPOSED, Is this why they oppose 370? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivhshankar
snippet.description:

snippet.title: Karnataka hit by COVID health crisis but medical infrastructure on a ventilator? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Padmaja Joshi, Super Investigation: 5 days, 58 dead on way to Bengaluru hospitals. We show why Bengaluru deaths ‘spiked’ as 11 hospitals reveal ‘apathy’.

Karnataka had fewer incidents of COVID earlier but suddenly there has been a spike. Private hospitals in all cities are not really cooperating as we expect them to do. Certainly hard measures on the way. Karnataka has been one of the best-managed states as far as COVID is concerned. say BJP MP & National Spokesperson GVL Narasimha Rao.

A lot of private hospitals were very reluctant to cooperate with govt authorities in Chennai. say,  Actor Kasturi Shankar.

It is not mismanagement; rather it is ‘corruption’ which is killing COVID in Karnataka. says, JD(S) National Spokesperson Tanveer Ahmed.

Watch!

snippet.title: Aaditya to contest polls, Does Shiv Sena have no faith in BJP?| India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
Home Minister Amit Shah on upcoming Maharashtra & Haryana assembly elections
Watch: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEVW4MKIjTU
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, this will be the first time when a member of the Thackeray family will contest an election. Shiv Sena announced that Aaditya Thackeray, President of Yuva Sena & the elder son of party chief Uddhav Thackeray will contest the upcoming elections from Worli Assembly constituency. He even said that he has his eyes on the Chief Minister's chair.

Does Shiv Sena have no faith in BJP?

snippet.title: Congress admits 'China is superior' in 2013 but then doubts Indian army in 2020? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Times Now excesses the exclusive admission made by the UPA era minister, defence minister A.K Antony to questions asked of him in parliament. that the UPA failed to close the gap between China and building infrastructure that would have helped the armed forces better repulse any Chinese advance on our territory.

Take a look at Congress' 2013 ‘surrender’ admission. ‘Will Gandhi's clear air on MoU?’

Signed MoU with China in 2008, admits ‘China is superior’ in 2013 but Congress doubts Army in 2020. BJP questions Rahul Gandhi-China 'Deal'.

We must also remember that there was the Beijing Olympics in 2008 and Xi Jinping was not in power. A governmental deal is always under judicial scrutiny. says, Sr. Advocate Sanjay Hegde.

During the 2008 Beijing Olympics, China invited Sonia Gandhi but not Manmohan Singh. says, BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra.

#CongSurrenderAdmission

snippet.title: China loses 9K cr 4G race, Will opposition still doubt NDA? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, India packs a 2nd big 'power punch' as PM Narendra Modi deletes his own Weibo account.

Samajwadi Party has always said that the biggest threat India faces is from China. says, SP Former Minister & Spokesperson Prof. Abhishek Mishra.

Govt of India is going step-by-step whatever needs to be done over China issue. says, BJP MP & National Spokesperson Dr Sudhanshu Trivedi. 

Steps like these (banning Chinese apps) have also been taken in UK & US against the Chinese 5G. It’s a worldwide move and nothing related to the LAC standoff. says, Political Analyst Abbas Hafeez Bhopal.

Lawyer Shehzad cites one of the statements made by a Samajwadi Party spokesperson on banning Chinese apps in the past which contradicts with the statement made by SP Former Minister & Spokesperson Prof. Abhishek Mishra.

#CoronaReportRow

snippet.title: Bengaluru Riots: CDR reveals Congress hand; Escaped in 1984, Exposed in 2020? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, August 11, the violence broke out in Bengaluru's DJ Halli and KG Halli areas over an alleged inciting social media post. More than 1,000 people resorted to arson while protesting against a derogatory Facebook post on Prophet Muhammad allegedly by the nephew of a Congress MLA Akhanda Srinivas Murthy (Pulakeshi Nagar constituency) in the Kavalbyrasandra area of Bengaluru City. 

Times Now accesses the CDR (Call data records) of ex-Congress Mayor Sampath Raj & aides of August 11. The CDR reveals that Sampath Raj called other accused in this case.

Author Anand Ranganathan in a view says, "Stoking violence or peddling outrage in non-Congress States has been the Congress' time-tested strategy."

#BengaluruRiotFinalProof

NIA affidavit names men & modus and levels 'conspiracy against India' allegation. People linked to State CM Pinarayi Vijayan under the scanner.

Suneet Chopra, Senior Leader, CPI(M) rubbishes the NIA’s claims on the Kerala Gold Scandal. Rather than believing IT Cell propaganda, NIA should do some investigation says Kevin Mathews, Political Analyst. The Kerala CM has much to answer says BJP Leader Amit Malviya. One of the suspected in the case is expected to have links to Dawood Ibrahim. Was CM Pinarayi Vijayan aware?.

snippet.title: Randeep Guleria of AIIMS on COVID cases; Are we prepared for the pandemic peak? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
Spike in the number of COVID cases worries. AIIMS Delhi Head Randeep Guleria wades-in & predicts a peak in the number between June & July. Are we prepared for the pandemic peak?

The virus will spread if we’re not responsible enough. Each citizen should behave responsibly now. We have to assess ways how we can reduce the number of cases in the high-risk areas. The needs of migrant workers should be ignored. I think the next 2 weeks will give us an idea about when can we possibly flatten the curve, says Randeep Guleria, AIIMS Director tells Rahul Shivshankar 

Watch Rahul Shivshankar in conversation with Randeep Guleria on INDIA UPFRONT Special Edition.

Rehan Siddiqi works through 2 other Indian conduits named Darshan Mehta and Rakesh Kaushal.
The various Bollywood A-Listers linked to Rehan Siddiqi are- Saif Ali Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Madhuri Dikshit, Salman Khan, Mika Singh, Shreya Ghoshal, Diljit Dosanjh, Arijit Singh, Sonu Nigam. 
The 3 individuals who are responsible for this haven even been blacklisted and can never come to India.

snippet.title: Hathras Case: Is BJP hinting at an encounter for justice? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, we discuss the brutality and violation in the Hathras case. ‘Bharat ki Beti’ was violated twice, the first breach came from the brutes who gang-raped her and injured her severely, the second by the State.

The victim’s body was forcefully cremated in the dead of the night and the family was not allowed anywhere near. In fact, they were also denied one last glimpse of their daughter. Atishi, Spokesperson for AAP, has remarked on the case. She said ’People like rapists, in this case, think that they can get away with it.’ 

BJP’s Kailash Vijayvirgiya has given out a rather scary statement where he has hinted at an encounter. He said that the accused have been arrested and the case is in a fast-track court, all that people need to do is be patient. He went on to add, ‘Under CM Yogi’s rule, cars can topple anytime’.

#HathrasGangrape #JusticeForBharatKiBeti

snippet.title: Face-off over Gita blackout, Is it really Hindutva Hegemony? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
On India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar, Anna University is facing the criticism for the last few days after the varsity has prescribed to include Bhagavad Gita as an audit course (non-compulsory) for postgraduate engineering students. MDMK leader Vaiko alleges the move is an attempt to impose Hindutva. Even DMK is opposing bit to introduce chapters from the Bhagavad Geeta as part of personality development through life enhancement course. 

Is reading the Bhagavad Gita really 'Hindutva Hegemony'?

snippet.title: Fight for the White House begins; Will Trump come back for another term? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
In this episode of India Upfront, Rahul Shivshankar talks about the much-discussed and debated, the U.S Presidential Elections, which have kickstarted from today. Everyone has got their eyes glued to the U.S elections and what the result will be. Furthermore, what impact will the election bring on to the global markets is what the people are hooked onto.

To discuss the first day of U.S elections, Rahul Shivshankar is joined by Allan Lichtman, the man who predicted the last 9 US Presidents. On the Trump vs Biden fight, Allan Lichtman further explains the process of how his team came up with the '13 keys to the White Formula'. snippet.title: Is Pakistan Prime Minister trying to divert focus from his own country? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On The India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar talks about a letter written to the CEO of Facebook Mark Zuckerberg by Pakistan Prime Minister, seeking a ban on Islamophobic content. In the letter, Imran Khan was seen targeting France and India, he even citied towards the CAA Act. Countering his allegation, France has responded back by attacking Imran for not accepting the fact that ‘Islam has a problem’
Pakistan Prime Minister peddles fake facts in the propaganda war. Is confronting radicals, Islamophobia?
While, Lawyer Shehzad and Omar Altaf, Journalist, debate how Ahmadiyya Muslims are treated in Pakistan, Author Tarek Fatah says ‘Muslims should stop every Idiotic thing they have inherited from their predecessors if they want to end Islamophobia’ He further goes on to question ‘Have they forgotten 9/11, Mumbai, Parliament attack?’

snippet.title: Rahul Gandhi refuses to travel to frontline but has time to meet Chinese envoy? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, RaGa is a part of Parliamentary Standing Committee on Defence, which has till date met for 11 meetings between September 2019 & March 2020. But, Rahul Gandhi ‘Skipped’ all of them, confirms Chairman of Defence panel.

I don’t think that anybody can deny the import of a Parliamentary Standing Committee particularly on a strategic matter of defence. says, Congress Leader Sanjay Jha.

Perhaps Rahul Gandhi doesn’t wish to be a better Parliamentarian. His track record in the last Parliament session or in terms of attendance & questions were ‘pathetic'. says, BJP National Spokesperson Nalin Kohli.

It’s disappointing that Rahul Gandhi hasn’t attended a single meeting, which I believe he should have. But it’s not the issue now. says, Political Analyst Sumanth Raman.

#RahulExposed

snippet.title: Embarrassed Congress denied brawl, pictures nail its deceit? | India Upfront With Rahul Shivshankar
snippet.description:
Even as Congress legislators continued to deny reports of a brawl between party MLA's lodged at the Eagleton resort, photographs of injured MLA Anand Singh showed that the party lawmakers were indeed involved in a scuffle.
The scuffle broke out between Singh and another MLA J.N. Ganesh and the latter, along with his party colleague Bheema Naik allegedly hit Singh. Later in the evening, Ganesh was suspended from the party. 
Is the ugly face of 'Gathbandhan' out?

snippet.title: PM Narendra Modi lays out priorities, Lazer-like focus on the poor? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, ‘Unmatched’ free food scheme: 80 crores poor to benefit. PM Narendra Modi walks 'Gaon-Garib' talk, but the Opposition questions the govt on the implementation of this scheme. 

I'd like to congratulate the Prime Minister for his vision. says, JD(U) Spokesperson Dr Ajay Alok.

The war of words between SP Spokesperson Ghanshyam Tiwari  & JD(U) Spokesperson Dr Ajay Alok over PM’s relief for poor.

We must ensure that our poor have enough food on their plates. says, BJP's  National Spokesperson Amit Malviya.

As a nation, you have to be rich to be pro-poor. says, Author Anand Ranganathan.

#ModiCareForPoor

snippet.title: TMC leader Manish Shukla killed;  BJP & TMC play victim card; Who is guilty then? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, he talks about the recent killing of a BJP leader that has taken place in West Bengal. In less than three months, there have been 13 killings on the streets of West Bengal. There has been grotesque violence in this latest attack, as a BJP councillor has been killed and the crime took place in front of a police station. Both BJP and TMC play a victim card, but who is really guilty? 

To discuss on the same topic, Rahul Shivshankar is joined by Shehzad Poonawalla, Sudhanshu Trivedi, Tauseef Rahman on the show. Shehzad Poonawalla hits at TMC by stating that this is Talibani mindset and culture in the display. Sudhanshu Trivedi, MP and National spokesperson BJP adds that there is a series of political killings in West Bengal. 

Tauseef Rahman tells Rahul Shivshankar that Manish Shukla was involved in a lot of personal and family problems also.

snippet.title: PM Modi's strategic coup to sail with U.S, Japan and Australia; China isolated? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, Australia’s decision to join next month’s Malabar exercise involving the navies of the four Quad nations will go a long way in emphasizing the group’s growing importance in the wake of China’s belligerent behaviour in the Asia-Pacific region.

The idea of the Quad was crystallized in 2005 to speed up intelligence sharing and strategic ties between India, Australia, Japan and the US, all leading democracies in the Asia-Pacific region.

Observer Research Foundation (ORF) Senior Fellow Sushant Sareen in a view says that Quad has been an idea until now. It has not been operationalized. 

"The only way to balance China is that we need to have an alliance of democracy. The nation must give primacy to the national security interest," says Defence Analyst Major General (Dr) GD Bakshi.
#ChinaIsolated

snippet.title: SSR Death Probe: Homicide angle not ruled out; Should 'Suicide Lobby' be probed now? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront today, Rahul Shivshankar demonstrates some of the exclusive newsbreaks in the Sushant Singh Rajput death Case. A closed-door meeting was been held by the AIIMS authorities and CBI team to discuss the preliminary findings. The report is also said to be final and conclusive.  

Times Now has accessed two explosive breakthroughs, first, Sushant’s handwritten notes which were reportedly optimistic and second, WhatsApp chats between Showik Chakraborty & drug peddlers where Showik allegedly insisted on procuring top class drugs.

Meanwhile, RJD MLA Arun Yadav’s remark against Sushant has sparked a major political row. Arun in his statement stated that Sushant is not a Rajput. Even the Central Agencies have not ruled out homicide angle, will the suicide lobby be probed now?

While Advocate Surender Chauhan says, ‘Let’s await the AIIMS report on SSR’s death’, BJP Spokesperson Sambit Patra says, ‘ I firmly believe that RJD is doing what it is best known for – ‘casteist’ slur even for a victim’

snippet.title: Coronavirus doubling rate slows to 11 days, Right time to ease the lockdown? | India Upfront
snippet.description:
On India Upfront with Rahul Shivshankar, 3 days to go for Lockdown 2.0. Doubling rate slows to 11 days, Coronavirus count crosses 33,000. But the spike in Gujarat & Bengal is under the lens. ‘Is it the right time to ease lockdown?’

Day after relief to stranded Indians, lakhs sign up to register for relief. PM Narendra Modi-HM Amit Shah holds intense discussions & 3-point action plan is being readied. 

 Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari recommends Election Commission of India (ECI)  to declare elections for 9 vacant council seats in the State. 9 seats are vacant since Apr 24. The deadline for CM Uddhav Thackeray ends of May 27.
